docs.snippet: LEAD: Zelia P. Ruebhausen, a civic leader, died of ovarian cancer yesterday at her winter home in Rancho Santa Fe, Calif. She was 75 years old and also lived in Manhattan....
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Zelia P. Ruebhausen, a civic leader, died of ovarian cancer yesterday at her winter home in Rancho Santa Fe, Calif. She was 75 years old and also lived in Manhattan.

headline.main: Zelia Ruebhausen, 75, Long a Civic Leader

docs.snippet: LEAD: The Uptown String Quartet embodies a wonderful idea - a string quartet that can not only handle European classical style but that can also swing and improvise, and that plays music steeped in black American traditions. But in its enjoyable N...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The Uptown String Quartet embodies a wonderful idea - a string quartet that can not only handle European classical style but that can also swing and improvise, and that plays music steeped in black American traditions. But in its enjoyable New York debut on Monday night at the 92d Street Y, the quartet - Diane Monroe and Lesa Terry on violins, Maxine Roach on viola and Eileen Folson on cello - ran up against its technical limitations.

headline.main: Review/Jazz;   Half of Max Roach's Double Quartet

docs.snippet: LEAD: Ordinary people walk. Barbara Stanwyck strode, and when she did, the screen crackled. She was many people - the sad, silly Stella Dallas, the icy murderess of ''Double Indemnity,'' the enchanting con woman of ''The Lady Eve'' and the slangy ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Ordinary people walk. Barbara Stanwyck strode, and when she did, the screen crackled. She was many people - the sad, silly Stella Dallas, the icy murderess of ''Double Indemnity,'' the enchanting con woman of ''The Lady Eve'' and the slangy showgirl of ''Ball of Fire'' - but all of them were monuments to vitality.

headline.main: Topics of The Times;   Ball of Fire

docs.snippet: LEAD: Barbara Stanwyck, the luminous star of such classic movies as ''Stella Dallas,'' ''The Lady Eve'' and ''Double Indemnity'' and the award-winning western television series ''The Big Valley,'' died of congestive heart failure late Saturday at ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Barbara Stanwyck, the luminous star of such classic movies as ''Stella Dallas,'' ''The Lady Eve'' and ''Double Indemnity'' and the award-winning western television series ''The Big Valley,'' died of congestive heart failure late Saturday at St. John's Hospital and Health Center in Santa Monica, Calif.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Meryl Streep acts silly, Tom Cruise looks grungy and Danny DeVito is the voice of reason; this season's films have been a parade of big-name stars acting against type. And while Ms. Streep is hilarious as the husband-stealing romance writer ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Meryl Streep acts silly, Tom Cruise looks grungy and Danny DeVito is the voice of reason; this season's films have been a parade of big-name stars acting against type. And while Ms. Streep is hilarious as the husband-stealing romance writer draped in acres of pink satin in ''She-Devil,'' and Mr. Cruise flawless as the paraplegic Vietnam veteran in ''Born on the Fourth of July,'' their performances are enhanced by an undeniable layer of surprise.

headline.main: Kudos Come When Actors Abandon Type

docs.snippet: LEAD: Words, as every poet knows, have a music of their own, especially when spoken sonorously by gifted performers. So why paint the lily? Yet the wedding of words to music is almost as old as poetry itself, and when the collaboration is between ...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Words, as every poet knows, have a music of their own, especially when spoken sonorously by gifted performers. So why paint the lily? Yet the wedding of words to music is almost as old as poetry itself, and when the collaboration is between geniuses, even though centuries apart - as when Mendelssohn underscored ''A Midsummer Night's

headline.main: Saying It With Music as Well as the Words

byline.original: By PAUL KRESH; Paul Kresh conducts ''The Story Department'' program on WQXR-AM

docs.snippet: LEAD: Imagine receiving national acclaim as a painter at the tender age of 22, only to slip into the shadows of a fickle, mostly uncaring art world for the rest of one's long and prolific career. Such has been the discouraging story for Jack Levin...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Imagine receiving national acclaim as a painter at the tender age of 22, only to slip into the shadows of a fickle, mostly uncaring art world for the rest of one's long and prolific career. Such has been the discouraging story for Jack Levine, one of the foremost Social Realists of his generation, a satirist whose gritty urban iconography and brassy style have often led to comparisons with Goya and Daumier.

docs.snippet: LEAD: The new Age of Austerity may have begun, but the back-to-back preview parties for the Winter Antiques Show were pretty grand. The show is still the premier event for antiques collectors and connoisseurs as well as interior decorators and the...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The new Age of Austerity may have begun, but the back-to-back preview parties for the Winter Antiques Show were pretty grand. The show is still the premier event for antiques collectors and connoisseurs as well as interior decorators and their clients.

docs.snippet: LEAD: Barbara Stanwyck, the luminous protagonist of such classic movies as ''Stella Dallas,'' ''The Lady Eve'' and ''Double Indemnity'' and the award-winning western television series ''The Big Valley'' in the 1960's, died of congestive heart fail...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Barbara Stanwyck, the luminous protagonist of such classic movies as ''Stella Dallas,'' ''The Lady Eve'' and ''Double Indemnity'' and the award-winning western television series ''The Big Valley'' in the 1960's, died of congestive heart failure yesterday in a hospital in Santa Monica, Calif. She was 82 years old.

headline.main: Barbara Stanwyck, Actress, Is Dead in California at 82

docs.snippet: LEAD: The massacre of six Jesuit priests, their housekeeper and her daughter in El Salvador in November brought to center stage the failure of U.S. assistance to end political killings by the Salvadoran Army. Congress must find out why, after $1 b...
docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: The massacre of six Jesuit priests, their housekeeper and her daughter in El Salvador in November brought to center stage the failure of U.S. assistance to end political killings by the Salvadoran Army. headline.main: Are We Shielding the Killers of Salvador's Priests?
